questions.question: What do all living things need to survive?
Which of the following is a living thing?
Who are producers in a food chain?
Which animal eats both plants and animals?
Which living thing gives shelter to animals?
Which living thing cleans the air?
What do animals give out while breathing?
Which living thing makes soil fertile?
Which animal helps in seed dispersal?
Which comes first in a food chain?
Which living thing lives in water?
Which living thing gives us food directly?
Which part of plant helps in breathing?
Which living thing depends on others?
Which animal helps farmers in ploughing?
Which living thing depends on soil?
Which living thing gives shelter to birds?
Which animal lives on land and water?
Which animal depends on plants directly?
Which living thing gives us fruits?
Which living thing maintains balance in nature?
What is interdependence?
questions.answer: Interdependence means living things depend on each other to survive.

questions.question: Why do animals depend on plants?
questions.answer: Animals depend on plants for food and oxygen.

questions.question: Why do plants depend on animals?
questions.answer: Plants depend on animals for pollination and seed dispersal.

questions.question: What are producers?
questions.answer: Producers are plants that make their own food.

questions.question: What are consumers?
questions.answer: Consumers are living things that depend on others for food.

questions.question: What is a food chain?
questions.answer: A food chain shows how food passes from one living thing to another.

questions.question: Why are plants important in a food chain?
questions.answer: Plants are the starting point of food chains.

questions.question: What do omnivores eat?
questions.answer: Omnivores eat both plants and animals.

questions.question: Why is sunlight important for plants?
How do plants clean the air?
questions.answer: Plants absorb carbon dioxide and release oxygen.

questions.question: What is pollination?
questions.answer: Pollination is the transfer of pollen from one flower to another.

questions.question: What is seed dispersal?
questions.answer: Seed dispersal is the spreading of seeds to new places.

questions.question: How do birds help in seed dispersal?
questions.answer: Birds carry seeds to different places.

questions.question: What happens if plants disappear?
questions.answer: Animals and humans will not survive.

questions.question: Why are forests important?
questions.answer: Forests provide food and shelter to many living things.

questions.question: How do animals help humans?
questions.answer: Animals give food and help in work.

questions.question: Why do living things need water?
questions.answer: Water is needed for growth and survival.

questions.question: What is a habitat?
questions.answer: A habitat is the home of a living thing.

questions.question: How do plants help humans?
questions.answer: Plants give food, oxygen, and medicines.

questions.question: Why is balance in nature important?
questions.answer: Balance keeps all living things safe.

questions.question: What role do trees play?
questions.answer: Trees provide oxygen, food, and shelter.

questions.question: Why should we protect plants?
questions.answer: Plants are necessary for life on earth.

questions.question: How do humans depend on plants?
questions.answer: Humans depend on plants for food and oxygen.

questions.question: How do humans depend on animals?
questions.answer: Humans depend on animals for food and work.

questions.question: What is a herbivore?
questions.answer: A herbivore is an animal that eats plants.

questions.question: What is a carnivore?
questions.answer: A carnivore is an animal that eats other animals.

questions.question: What is an omnivore?
questions.answer: An omnivore eats plants and animals.

questions.question: Why do living things help each other?
What do living things share?
questions.answer: They share food, air, and water.

questions.question: What do animals give out while breathing?
Why do plants need carbon dioxide?
questions.answer: Plants use it to make food.

questions.question: How does interdependence help life?
questions.answer: It helps living things survive together.

questions.question: What lesson do we learn from nature?
questions.answer: All living things depend on each other.

questions.question: Why is water important for plants?
